instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA: What is PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA? PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA is a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state that powers the SMC that comes from PP3V3_S5. A blown or corroded L4901 inductor behind it can kepe it from working, inductor number will differ depending on your board. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message:
USing 85W charger, getting only 12.3V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. NO light on charger adapter. Replaced DCIN adapter with many different. <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> is low usually at .7V sometimes at 1.3V (diode check red to ground there is .6V). I checked trace from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to SMC and .9 ohms resistance. I've swapped the SMC 3 times and reballed etc... Replaced <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>.

Board does not start with battery and trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> either.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message: As always you have to check <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_SMC_VDDA</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message:
Incorrect <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, there is a communication problem between SMC and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Did you test disconnecting BIL?
Post voltage and diode mode to ground ay SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message: Scl/sda lines are 3 mV difference. Board is out of the Mac so no BIL connected. Iâ€™ll swap the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and check continuity between it and SMC where relevant.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message:
Swap why???

"diode mode to ground ay SCL/SDA lines"
You've said something about 3mV.
I supposed to be voltage.
Many tinmes I said do not post "V" for diode mode readings...

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message: When I checked them they were .003 apart.  .504 vs .507 diode red to ground

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message:
Diode mode values look good, but voltage?
If equal, then could be bad SMC, or <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (less probable).
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is OK.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7000</RESISTOR> is good. Voltage at SDA/SCL charger only is 3.49V. I tried swapping <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> just in case being I already tried the SMC at least 3 times with no change in results.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message: Any chance this could be firmware related?

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message:
Did you change SMC 3 times???
Be sure to use one from donor 3115 board.
Still no Magsafe light?

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message: Yes, used from 3115 donors. No MagSafe light and no boost of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message: Would be very unusual but you should check components in Y5010 circuit and continuity across traces. Also confirm no short to ground on <SIGNAL>PP1V2_S5_SMC_VDDC</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message:
Check voltages and signals for <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (2 OF 2) at page 45.

Do you get <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>?
Possibly not, but you didn't correctly reply to a previous question.
You've been asked about <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>.
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5_SMC</SIGNAL> comes from <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, not from L7220.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message:
I do not get <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>. It is 0V. SO you're right I don't get <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>. I actually thought I had checked that before but Piernov asked for <SIGNAL>3V3_S5_SMC</SIGNAL> specifically.

Doesn't appear to be a short there. I traded out the <CHIP>U7941</CHIP> just in case. So if not the SMC then must be the trace from SMC to <CHIP>U7941</CHIP>?

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message:
"Check voltages and signals for <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> (2 OF 2) at page 45."
???

Any oscillation at <SIGNAL>SMC_E</SIGNAL>/XTAL?
Post DC level at least.

threads.title: 3115 not boosting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to 12.6V SMC Swapathon
threads.message: DAH it was related to the a missing trace from Y5010 to <RESISTOR>R5010</RESISTOR> AND a bad DCIN board. Now I'm getting 12.65V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and fan spin. Thanks Guys!
